revised_title: Vibrational Energy Distribution and Production Mechanism in Flash Photolysis of NO2
tldr: The authors studied the flash photolysis of nitric oxide (NO2) and observed the production of vibrationally excited oxygen. They found that about 20% of the exothermic reaction energy appears as vibrational energy in oxygen. The authors also investigated the mechanism for the production of superexcited oxygen and measured the absolute populations of the excited levels.
